review_pos: Very good location. Great coffee, decent breakfast. I could take a shower before my flight after I had checked out which was great.
review_neg: The staff was very friendly but quite reserved and not very "present" (they are in a back room and you have to call them if you need anything). Felt more like in a hotel or even more anonymous. My mattress was super squeaky, so every time I turned I woke up (myself and probably the whole dorm).

review_pos: Fantastic location near multiple MRT’s on different lines which made it ideal for getting around! It was great to have a double bed in a hostel and we found the underneath storage section very useful. Overall, super clean and quiet and we appreciated the free breakfast which was always well stocked.
review_neg: The bathroom wasn’t great, there was no AC so very hot in there and the showers were luke warm.
review_text: Fantastic location near multiple MRT’s on different lines which made it ideal for getting around! It was great to have a double bed in a hostel and we found the underneath storage section very useful. Overall, super clean and quiet and we appreciated the free breakfast which was always well stocked. The bathroom wasn’t great, there was no AC so very hot in there and the showers were luke warm.

review_pos: - extremely helpful lady on reception- despite being in a dorm, the beds felt very private and everyone was extremely courteous- A locked safe to store valuables and an area to hang up clothes- on a lively street with lots of food and drink options- well located and within walking distance of various train stations and bus stops to help get around the city.- Good air con in room (an absolute must in Singapore!)
review_neg: - the double bed options are "small doubles". We had back ache after trying to squeeze both of us into the bed comfortably for 5 nights. Would have been absolutely fine for a shorter stay. - we booked a double bed in a dorm. There isn't much room for two people's luggage around the double bed, so try and pack light/compact! - the front door (on a busy street) is always open and the doors to the bedrooms are kept open during the day (at night you have to use your key card). Thankfully Singapore is a safe country, so I imagine bulglaries are rare! - the music from the surrounding bars is loud. We didn't find this to be too much of a problem, but bear it in mind if you are an extremely light sleeper. The hostel provides free earplugs to help minimise noise.
review_text: - extremely helpful lady on reception- despite being in a dorm, the beds felt very private and everyone was extremely courteous- A locked safe to store valuables and an area to hang up clothes- on a lively street with lots of food and drink options- well located and within walking distance of various train stations and bus stops to help get around the city.- Good air con in room (an absolute must in Singapore!) - the double bed options are "small doubles". We had back ache after trying to squeeze both of us into the bed comfortably for 5 nights. Would have been absolutely fine for a shorter stay. - we booked a double bed in a dorm. There isn't much room for two people's luggage around the double bed, so try and pack light/compact! - the front door (on a busy street) is always open and the doors to the bedrooms are kept open during the day (at night you have to use your key card). Thankfully Singapore is a safe country, so I imagine bulglaries are rare! - the music from the surrounding bars is loud. We didn't find this to be too much of a problem, but bear it in mind if you are an extremely light sleeper. The hostel provides free earplugs to help minimise noise.

review_neg: The fan next to the bed almost doesn't reach the power outlet, could attach a power bar so we can plug more things in.

review_pos: The location is really perfect on Circular Road / Boat Quay area. You can go to the most popular sites by walk and the city is amazing for that. Many places (restaurants, bar, museums, parks) nearby.The hostel is the most clean and welcoming hostel I have been. The common living room is warm, nice, comfortable and there is a good atmosphere, I’ve spent lots of time here working, chilling, having breakfast or dinner. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated, very private, the desk is really a plus, the bed is comfy. Bathroom is modern and clean, the best hostel bathroom that I have ever seen. This place is really different from other hostels and can you feel like home sometimes.Breakfast is provided with coffee, tea, cereals, toasts.The staff is nice and available. I have been there 1 week and it was so great. I will come back for sure! Thank you
review_neg: The street can be noisy some nights since there are lots of bars and nightclubs. However, it did not last very late and free earplugs are provided when you check-in so this was not a big issue to me.The room at the 4th floor lacks a window, this is always dark but you can stay at level 2 in the common living room that is really great.Breakfast stops at 10am, it could be a little bit longer.Nothing much to say as my stay was amazing.
review_text: The location is really perfect on Circular Road / Boat Quay area. You can go to the most popular sites by walk and the city is amazing for that. Many places (restaurants, bar, museums, parks) nearby.The hostel is the most clean and welcoming hostel I have been. The common living room is warm, nice, comfortable and there is a good atmosphere, I’ve spent lots of time here working, chilling, having breakfast or dinner. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated, very private, the desk is really a plus, the bed is comfy. Bathroom is modern and clean, the best hostel bathroom that I have ever seen. This place is really different from other hostels and can you feel like home sometimes.Breakfast is provided with coffee, tea, cereals, toasts.The staff is nice and available. However, it did not last very late and free earplugs are provided when you check-in so this was not a big issue to me.The room at the 4th floor lacks a window, this is always dark but you can stay at level 2 in the common living room that is really great.Breakfast stops at 10am, it could be a little bit longer.Nothing much to say as my stay was amazing.

review_pos: The staff, Ms. Riza was very nice and accommodating. The hostel was just about a 5-minute walk to Clarke Quay MRT. The place is a hostel, it's not as private as a hotel but it has the basic necessities like simple breakfast, coffee, a common area, shared bathroom, etc. The sleeping quarters offers some sort of privacy as well so it's ok. Wifi was also fast
review_neg: The hostel is located near bars and clubs so it was noisy in the evening. The staff gave earplugs though so that was helpful. During my stay, there was only one shower working so it was a bit inconvenient in the morning.

review_pos: Great location, lovely comfy bed, nice and private with a desk and luggage space underneath. Everyone was fairly quiet and got on with their own thing, so not that sociable if you're after that. Really clean, staff lovely and helpful. Simple help yourself breakfast but all very good. I wondered why they gave you earplugs when checking in... Then I heard the Bollywood bass kick in after 9pm from the club underneath. I slept through it, but if you're a light sleeper!?? WiFi was excellent in all rooms
review_neg: If I had to be really picky it would be the aircon in the room, either freezing or too warm. Remotes didn't seem to change the temp 🤷‍♀️And only 2 shower cubicles which just had frosted glass... Could pretty much see everything when someone showered 🙈

We had a late bus and they allowed us to chill at their common space which is very cool and comfortable.The location is just perfect as we could walk to the main attractions of the city.

review_pos: I loved the location. Air-conditioning worked well. Staff was very helpful and lovely! I was so happy I could leave my luggage there for my last day so I could roam around the city easily. Lots of restaurants and bars next to the hotel. Had lunch for 3SGD across the street. Coffee at the hostel was delicious also!
review_neg: There was a nightclub downstairs which i wasn't aware of, they played music very loud till 1:30am every night. Showers were not 100% private which was bit uncomfortable. Lighting in the room was not as bright as the pictures showed and generally hostel was way smaller than in pictures.

Washing room is for both gender, I personally don’t feel very comfortable running into half naked dudes. Curtains enclose the room space so at times loud snoring echos across. Lounge is really nice but has no ac. I don’t think I’ll stay in mixed gender hotels anymore. Ah well but price is good

review_pos: The big bed with a curtain drawn around it was better than a pod.
review_neg: The coffeeshop opposite had many drinkers at night and they were noisy.

review_pos: convenient location , walking distance to ChinaTown which is great for cheap eats ,right by Clark quay bars / restaurants right down stairs of hostel which might get noisy at times after 11PM , I had a good sleep tho, they offer ear plugs . friendly staff at check in  .
review_neg: breakfast is from 7am-10am, woke up at 7 for breakfast , wanted to have good coffee they provided with espresso machine , it wasn't turn on yet , Kaya jam was pretty much out , the only thing I like about breakfast was cereal with fresh milk
